channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Buyers are gaining the upper hand in a shifting housing market. ‘Everybody wants a deal.’
item.description: A shift is happening during the busiest season for the real-estate industry.

item.title: This investor banks on Munger’s advice to ride out volatility in markets and Tesla
item.description: Money manager Christopher Tsai says he pays scant attention to daily market ups and downs, except to look for stock opportunities.

item.title: My husband and I used joint funds to renovate and prepare his house for sale. Do I now own half?
item.description: “My name is not on the deed to that rental home, but we have been married 15 years.”

item.title: Advance Auto Parts’ stock rockets as tariffs didn’t change the earnings outlook
item.description: On Thursday, the company said it’ll handle the extra costs tied to the current tariff regime and still deliver its full-year earnings targets.

item.title: Surge in Treasury yields points to U.S. debt concerns as Trump’s tax bill advances. Investors want this fix.
item.description: There’s a list of things the White House could do to lower yields, but signing an executive order isn’t one of them, one portfolio manager said.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
